items.title: Nachtmerrie voor Isak: Liverpool-spits geopereerd aan kuitbeenbreuk
items.summary: Liverpool is Alexander Isak voorlopig kwijt. Uit onderzoek is gebleken dat de Zweedse spits zijn been gebroken heeft in de wedstrijd tegen Tottenham Hotspur (1-2).

items.title: Alexander Isak set to miss several months of season after Liverpool confirm fractured leg
items.summary: Record signing injured in win at Tottenham Striker underwent surgery after scan on Monday Alexander Isak is facing several months on the sidelines after undergoing surgery on a leg fracture suffered in Liverpool‚Äôs win at Tottenham. Liverpool have confirmed that Isak fractured his left leg when putting Arne Slot‚Äôs team ahead in Saturday‚Äôs 2-1 victory and being caught in a challenge from Micky van de Ven. Continue reading...

items.title: Liverpool striker Isak has surgery on broken leg
items.summary: Scans confirm Liverpool striker Alexander Isak's left leg was broken during the club's victory against Tottenham Hotspur on Saturday.

items.title: Liverpool confirm Isak leg fracture
items.summary: Liverpool have confirmed Alexander Isak suffered a leg fracture during Liverpool's 2-1 win over Tottenham on Saturday.

items.title: Humphries vs 'legendary' Lim after Aspinall, Van Veen win LIVE!
Roda klimt naar vierde plek, RKC te sterk voor gebroken Jong Ajax
items.summary: Roda JC Kerkrade heeft de knappe uitzege bij De Graafschap een vervolg gegeven met een driepunter bij Jong FC Utrecht. De Limburgers staan daardoor nu vierde in de Keuken Kampioen Divisie. RKC Waalwijk maakte een einde aan een reeks van drie competitienederlagen op rij, door het gebroken Jong Ajax aan de kant te zetten.

items.title: Heerlijke goals Neres bezorgen Napoli in spookdecor de Supercoppa
items.summary: Napoli heeft maandag beslag gelegd op de Supercoppa. In de finale in Saoedi-Arabi√´ was de landskampioen met 2-0 te sterk voor bekerwinnaar Bologna. David Neres besliste de partij met twee ragfijne goals.

items.title: Sources: Madrid's Endrick heads to Lyon on loan
items.summary: Lyon and Real Madrid agreed on Monday to a six-month loan for striker Endrick, sources told ESPN. The loan does not include an option to make the move permanent.

items.title: Kane smashes Arjen Robben record in Bayern rout
items.summary: Harry Kane scored his 30th club goal of the season as Bayern Munich shrugged off an injury and illness crisis to sweep past Heidenheim 4-0 on Sunday and go into the Bundesliga's winter break with a nine-point lead.

items.title: Neymar has minor surgery, WC with Brazil in play
items.summary: Neymar underwent minor surgery on his left knee, his club Santos said on Monday.

items.title: Sources: Alves buys Portuguese club, may play
items.summary: Former Barcelona and Brazil defender Dani Alves has finalised details to acquire Portuguese third division club Sporting Clube de S√£o Jo√£o de Ver, sources told ESPN Brazil's Bruno Andrade.

items.title: Farioli schuift zonder ook maar √©√©n competitienederlaag aan voor het kerstdiner
items.summary: Francesco Farioli kan met een goed gevoel onder de kerstboom kruipen. De coach van FC Porto zag zijn ploeg in de laatste wedstrijd voor de feestdagen (maar niet van dit kalenderjaar) met klinkende cijfers winnen van middenmoter Alverca.

items.title: B√ºttner is kraakhelder: 'Moet klaar zijn met die buitenlandse eigenaren in Arnhem'
items.summary: Alexander B√ºttner staat symbool voor de wonderlijke wederopstanding van Vitesse en maakt zich hard voor een sterke club in Nederlandse handen. Dit sprak hij uit in het VI Kerstnummer.

items.title: Fifa tests new technology for ball out of play and offside
items.summary: Fifa is testing new technology which can determine if the ball went out of play before a goal was scored.

items.title: Christmas Day NBA on Sky Sports: LeBron, Curry, Wembanyama and more!
items.summary: The NBA's Christmas Day game has been a tradition since 1947 and continues to showcase some of the league's biggest teams and superstars.

items.title: Saudi Prince threatened Sheff Utd with wind-up order
items.summary: Former Sheffield United owner Prince Abdullah of Saudi Arabia was poised to issue a winding-up order on the club over a ¬£10m debt owed to him by new owners COH Sports.

items.title: Milan‚Äôs Serie A match in Australia called off after ‚Äòunacceptable requests‚Äô
items.summary: Milan v Como was intended for Perth on 8 February Asian Football Confederation wanted to impose conditions The proposal to play a Serie A match between Milan and Como in Perth, Australia, has been cancelled due to football sanctions and conditions imposed by the Asian Football Confederation (AFC). The game was set to become the first major European domestic league fixture to be played outside its home country but will now not go ahead because of the financial risks and last-minute complications. Continue reading...

items.title: 'Just reach out' - Man Utd's Bennett on his father's suicide
items.summary: Manchester United defender Rhys Bennett discusses his father's death in October to help raise awareness of mental health issues.

items.title: Wolves‚Äô freefall leaves even Derby‚Äôs dismal record low a lofty goal
items.summary: A side that once looked resilient has collapsed into historic futility, with Wolves now facing the grim task of avoiding the worst season English league football has ever seen Saturday‚Äôs defeat at home to Brentford means Wolves have taken just two points for 17 games. No side in the entire history of English league football, in any division, has ever made a worse start than that. To reach 11 points, the record low for a Premier League season set by Derby County in 2007-08, would require a significant improvement. How can this have happened? Wolves finished 16th last season, recovering after a dismal start. When Vitor Pereira took over on 19 December last year, they were second bottom on nine points from 16 games. They picked up 23 points from the final 22 games of the season and effectively ended any prospect of relegation with a run of six successive victories in the spring. How can a team go from averaging near enough a point a game to a 10th of that? The drop-off is extraordinary. This is an extract from Soccer with Jonathan Wilson, a weekly look from the Guardian US at the game in Europe and beyond. Subscribe for free here. Have a question for Jonathan? Email soccerwithjw@theguardian.com, and he‚Äôll answer the best in a future edition. Continue reading...
